segments.text: Which social problem do you think the government needs to concentrate on most ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think housing is a big problem . There are thousands of homeless people on the streets .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How would you solve the problem ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I have a good idea to solve it . The government could provide some money for homeless people to build their own homes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It would probably be very expensive .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think the government can afford it . Besides , there are many advantages . Homeless people would find it easier to get jobs if they had an address . They would learn some useful skill for finding jobs i
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It ’ s not a bad idea . I think education is the biggest problem at the moment . Schools don ’ t seem to have enough money to educate kids properly .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If we are to invest more money to education , we will need to raise taxes . That wouldn ’ t be popular with voters .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Most voters what everything both ways . They want the government to pay for lots of things , but without increasing taxes .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The government should show that it is using money efficiently . Sometimes you hear about how the government has wasted money on a project .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . The government has limited funds and must show that it is using the money responsibly
segments.speaker: S1
